summary: A FedEx invoice dated December 23, 2002, detailing shipping charges for account holder Jeffrey E. Epstein. The document lists numerous shipments sent from and to Epstein's New York address, with recipients including known associates, staff, and businesses, providing a snapshot of his communications and logistics during this period.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The primary account holder for the FedEx invoice; shipments are sent from his New York address and to him at his Palm Beach address.

persons.name: G. Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as a recipient and sender on multiple FedEx shipments from Epstein's account; packages were signed for by 'MAXWELL'.

persons.name: Edwina Simmonds
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of a FedEx shipment paid for by Epstein's account.

connections.description: Multiple FedEx shipments were sent between Epstein and Maxwell, indicating frequent communication or logistical support.
Epstein paid for shipments sent to Edwina Simmonds, suggesting a professional or employment relationship.
A shipment was sent from Bran Ferren to Epstein, indicating a connection.
A shipment was sent from Sabel Maxwell to Epstein, indicating a connection.
A shipment was sent to Hugh Bake at 'Charities of Palm Beach', suggesting a potential charitable or financial connection.

events.title: FedEx Shipping Activity
events.description: Numerous FedEx shipments were sent and received under Jeffrey Epstein's account throughout December 2002, involving various individuals and organizations.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
Charities of Palm Beach (recipient address for Hugh Bake)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's primary mailing address in December 2002 was 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY.
Epstein also received packages at his Palm Beach, Florida residence at 358 El Brillo Way.
The FedEx invoice shows a high volume of shipping activity (34 express shipments) in a short period, indicating active communication and logistics.
Recipients and senders include several individuals later identified as Epstein associates or staff, such as Ghislaine Maxwell (listed as G. Maxwell and S. Maxwell) and Edwina Simmonds.
The document provides a detailed financial record of Epstein's business or personal expenses related to shipping and courier services.
